intro: Pedicularis ctenophora, commonly known as the tufted lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes various parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and meadows. It produces striking, reddish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native ecosystems.
